addStableSwapPool((uint32,bytes32),addre.details: Must pass in the _canonical information so it can be emitted in event

params._canonical: - The canonical id and domain to remove

params._key: - The hash of the canonical id and domain to remove (mapping key)

setupAsset((uint32,bytes32),uint8,string.details: When allowlisting the canonical asset, all representational assets would be allowlisted as well. In the event you have a different adopted asset (i.e. PoS USDC on polygon), you should *not* allowlist the adopted asset. The stable swap pool address used should allow you to swap between the local <> adopted asset. If a representation has been deployed at any point, `setupAssetWithDeployedRepresentation` should be used instead. The following can only be added on *REMOTE* domains: - `_adoptedAssetId` - `_stableSwapPool` Whereas the `_cap` can only be added on the canonical domain

params._adoptedAssetId: - The used asset id for this domain (e.g. PoS USDC for polygon)
params._canonical: - The canonical asset to add by id and domain. All representations will be allowlisted as well
params._canonicalDecimals: - The decimals of the canonical asset (will be used for deployed representation)
params._representationName: - The name to be used for the deployed asset
params._representationSymbol: - The symbol used for the deployed asset
params._stableSwapPool: - The address of the local stableswap pool, if it exists.

setupAssetWithDeployedRepresentation((ui.details: This function does very minimal checks to ensure the correct `_representation` token is used. The only enforced checks are: - Bridge can mint, and balance of bridge will increase - Bridge can burn, and balance of bridge will decrease However, there are many things that must be checked manually to avoid enrolling a bad representation: - decimals must always be equal to canonical decimals - regular `mint`, `burn`, `ERC20` functionality could be implemented improperly - the required interface functions (see `IBridgeToken`) may not be implemented - upgradeability could interfere with required functionality Using this method allows admins to override existing local tokens, and should be used carefully.

params._adoptedAssetId: - The used asset id for this domain (e.g. PoS USDC for polygon)
params._canonical: - The canonical asset to add by id and domain. All representations will be whitelisted as well
params._representation: - The address of the representative asset
params._stableSwapPool: - The address of the local stableswap pool, if it exists.

params._canonical: - The canonical id and domain to remove

TokenDeployed(uint32,bytes32,address).notice: emitted when a representation token contract is deployed

addStableSwapPool((uint32,bytes32),addre.notice: Adds a stable swap pool for the local <> adopted asset.

setupAssetWithDeployedRepresentation((ui.notice: Used to add supported assets, without deploying a unique representation asset, and instead using what admins have provided. This is an admin only function
